description.narrative: The High Commission for the â€œNigeriens Nourishing Nigeriensâ€ initiative and the technical services of ministries involved in the National Nutritional Security Policy have improved capacities to enact and disseminate nutrition policies, coordinate and monitor their implementation and mobilize financial resources., which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Evaluation And Research, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, adolescents and women, especially the most vulnerable and those affected by shocks, have increased access to and the utilization of promotional, preventive and curative nutrition services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The High Commission for the “Nigeriens Nourishing Nigeriens” initiative and the technical services of ministries involved in the National Nutritional Security Policy have improved capacities to enact and disseminate nutrition policies, coordinate and monitor their implementation and mobilize financial resources.

description.narrative: The involvement of the Ministry of Health through the Nutrition Directorate and the high commission for the 3N initiative depicts the high-level commitment of the Government to support Nutrition agenda in the country to prevent and fight all forms of malnutrition, even if this involvement still needs to be strengthened and translated into budget allocation. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/02/2020

title.narrative: Percentage of relevant sectoral strategies including sensitive and budgeted nutrition interventions
Adoption of the International Code on Marketing of Breastmilk substitutes as legislation and subsequent relevant World Health Assembly resolutions
The national MIS produces quaterly reports / dashboards on performance against key indicators for all districts within a month
Country has a budgeted plan to eliminate water and fluids to support increase in exclusive breastfeeding
Country has a budgeted plan to improve dietary diversity
Existence of a multisectoral and functional coordination framework at all levels (national and decentralized)
Existence of a functional sector or cluster coordination for nutrition
National or local Nutrition sector plans integrate risk management strategies addressing risks related to disasters, climate change, conflict, public health emergencies or other crises
